result.execSummary:
The defendant Grant Jeffrey Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk entered a corrected JOC to reflect After Revocation of Probation. This was incorrect. Defendant's DJOC was revoked, not probation. Clerk deleted corrected JOC.

9:16 Defendant Grant Jeffrey Simpson in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  Defendant Grant Jeffrey Simpson in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sticht and Nussberger agree by stipulation to have deferred revoked. Court grants motion and revokes DJOC. Judgment of conviction shall be entered. Sticht: 120 days jail on each count; concurrent to each other and  to Eau Claire County 17CF40. Nussberger agrees and addresses. Court: orders 120 days jail on each count concurrent and to Eau Claire County 17CF40. credit of 58 days. Release date: December 29. 2017.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

8:45  Defendant Grant Jeffrey Simpson in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan files amended information with 2 counts.  Misd battery and  misd. criminal damage to property.   DJC  2yrs.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights   DEF PLEADS GUILTY of court 1 and Count 2. Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty if Ct 1 & Ct.  2 of the amended information. Judgement of conviction is withheld at this time by the court and the DJC is approved by the court. $685.00 restitution is to be paid by the defendant. Court approves the DJC and signs the paperwork.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant  Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea to Count 1 and Count 2 at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court on both counts.    The bond will continue as ordered.  Bond conditions reviewed with defendant.    Pretrial Conference to be set.

2:06 p.m.   Defendant Grant Jeffrey Simpson in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.    Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Preliminary hearing at 03-17-2016 02:00 pm
Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
